constraint: The arithmetic expression shall contain at least one character that is neither a number (0-9), nor an arithmetic operator (+, -, *, /).
result: (exists ((i Int)) (and (>= i 0) (< i (str.len s)) (not (or (and (>= (str.to.int (str.at s i)) 0) (<= (str.to.int (str.at s i)) 9)) (str.contains "+-*/" (str.at s i))))))

constraint: The arithmetic expression shall contain consecutive arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /).
result: (exists ((i Int)) (and (>= i 0) (< i (- (str.len s) 1)) (str.contains "+-*/" (str.at s i)) (str.contains "+-*/" (str.at s (+ i 1)))))

constraint: The arithmetic expression shall contain an operator from the set {+, *, /} that either does not have a number immediately before it or does not have a number immediately after it.
result: (exists ((i Int)) (and (>= i 0) (< i (str.len s)) (or (and (str.contains "+*/" (str.at s i)) (or (not (and (>= i 1) (>= (str.to.int (str.at s (- i 1))) 0) (<= (str.to.int (str.at s (- i 1))) 9))) (not (and (< i (- (str.len s) 1)) (>= (str.to.int (str.at s (+ i 1))) 0) (<= (str.to.int (str.at s (+ i 1))) 9))))) (and (= i 0) (str.contains "+*/" (str.at s i))) (and (= i (- (str.len s) 1)) (str.contains "+*/" (str.at s i))))))

constraint: The arithmetic expression shall start with one of the operators in the set {+, *, /}.
